description: Buy the Thule T2 Pro X 2 Bike 2in Receiver online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: T2 Pro X 2 Bike 2in Receiver
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule T2 Pro X 2 Bike 2in Receiver online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've own mine for almost two years, it is very durable and easy to use. How would I go about and get a replacement key for the Thule lock? I have misplaced the key after I moved from California.
review.name: Awesome T2 Pro X

review.reviewBody: Doesn’t come with bike locks. It only comes with one lock which is used to lock the rack to the hitch. You would have to buy 2 additional locks for the 2 bikes, and then need 3 keys for the 3 locks.
review.name: Have to buy locks separately

review.reviewBody:
I bought my 3rd T2 Pro X this week (first stolen, second damaged in rear accident). The new version has much lower quality and is no longer fully functional or safe.

The metal rails supporting the bikes have been reduced in length by about 2”. My 61 cm frame road bike slightly hangs over. My 61 cm frame gravel bike with longer base almost completely hangs over held by the strap only - Unsafe!. My mountain bike rear wheel falls off the side - completely unusable.

The price has been reduced by $100 - good. But the rolling wheel has been removed and the built in bike locks have also been removed. Those were nice to have. I would have paid $100 more to keep them, but can live with it.

But cutting the length of the supporting rails by 2” makes this version of the T2 Pro X only partially useable for my road bike only, unsafe for my gravel bike, and completely unusable for my mountain bike.
review.name: Latest version of T2 Pro X not functional/unsafe
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on Thule T2 Pro X. I am sorry to hear the bike rack did not meet your needs as a cyclist. 
Thule T2 Pro X is designed to accommodate wheelbases up to 1245 mm / 49 in. This is slightly shorter than the upgraded model Thule T2 Pro XTR, which can hold bikes up to 1270 mm / 50 in, but bikes with a 61 mm wheelbase exceed the maximum mounting distance of even Thule's highest capacity bike racks. Built-in rolling wheels are also a feature on the Thule T2 Pro XTR model, not Thule T2 Pro X, leading to the difference in price. 
I am sorry that there was some miscommunication or misunderstanding on model compatibility or features. You can view the complete list of features and specifications in the "All features" and "Technical specifications" sections of the bike rack product page for future reference.

review.reviewBody: looks like it is made of good steel and has good black coating on the parts. To bad the front wheel holders did not have the lock assy. as a standard feature. It is a bit heavy but that is fine for me.Very solid and sturdy. Fits great on 2024 outback
review.name: good design

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been using the Thule 2t Pro X for about a month. I love it for the ease of installation and the features that allow for ease of loading two 48 pound e-bikes.
The easy action allows for quick effortless access to the tailgate of my Outback.
review.name: Easy to use functions!

review.reviewBody: Installation was straightforward, but I think it could have been simpler. The rack works flawlessly and is very robust. I have zero worries about my bikes when they are back there.
review.name: Good rack

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using this bike rack for about a month on a cross country trip on my Subaru Forester. My wife and I absolutely love it. It’s a bit heavy but feels very sturdy and robust. I love that it locks to the hitch receiver and that the hooks for the front wheels also have receptacles for the Thule core locks. If I had to make a complaint, I would like the rear tire strap to be a bit more robust and secure, but we have not had any issues. First time Thule buyer and very satisfied with our purchase!
review.name: Excellent, sturdy bike rack!

review.reviewBody: Quality product. Easy to operate. Love the tilt feature for when I need to get into my hatchback.
review.name: Superior Product!

review.reviewBody: I did like this bike rack but the locking mechanism to the rack itself was very cheap. My bike rack was stolen off my hitch even though it was locked on there. Pretty bummed to spend so much on a nice rack to have it not even actually be secure even after following all of the locking instructions. So disappointed. My hitch itself wasn’t damaged which leads me to believe there is an easy way to mess with the locking knob to get it off the hitch fairly easily. Buy an extra lock for security!’
review.name: Great rack, cheap locking mechanisms
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule T2 Pro X. I understand your frustration with the bike rack being stolen. It truly is an unfortunate situation. 
Thule locks provide a baseline of security for product and serve as a theft deterrent. However, a dedicated thief with the right tools and enough time can circumvent most security measures. If an accessory is planned to go unsupervised for an extended period of time, Thule always recommends additional security measures like external locks or removing the rack for storage in a secure area, as well as removing the bike rack when not in use..

review.reviewBody: Everyone knows how awesome Thule products are. One thing I want to give a heads up about is that it doesn't come with locks for the bike hooks , ans ainxe you have to buy those locks I would just buy the Thule one key system before installing the rack, since I already installed it ans the locks it came with, now I order more ans I have multiple keys. So just throw away the lock it come with and buy the one key system. Much easier
review.name: Buy the one key system with it.

name: T2 Pro X 2 Bike 2in Receiver

review.reviewBody:
I tried these on, along with the Bella Prima Knicker and the Hi-Rise Holster Capri, and opted to go with the Hi-Rise Holster. 

The capri is slightly longer than the knickers, and I much prefer the hi-rise waist band for ultimate smoothing through the middle, and keeping the waist band in place. (And after owning the Holster shorts, I am now a BIG fan of the pockets). 

The Breakaway is the cheapest of the 3, and I would say they did feel a bit cheaper. I Recommend splurging a little more on those Hi-Rise Holsters. 

I am generally a curvy 16 in bottoms, and wear an XXL in Terry.
review.name: Good, but not what I wanted.

review.itemreviewed: Fugitive GTX Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great boot so far, but only put about 10 miles on them from local hikes but excellent support on off camber slopes. Goretex liner can be hot, but seems most hiking boots come this way.
review.name: Solid Boot - Great Support

review.itemreviewed: Fugitive GTX Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and strong, very good protection
review.name: Trail Boot

review.itemreviewed: Fugitive GTX Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These boots are the real deal. I have a slightly wider foot (2E) and it is always very difficult to find boots that fit 'just right'. Luckily, the Fugitives offer a perfect fit with top-shelf quality. The build is really superb with these boots. They boast a leather and nylon upper with a full Gore-Tex bootie. The toe box offers plenty of room and the heel locks in securely. 

I recommend purchasing1 half size up and buying the "Sole Active Thick" insoles. These insoles are designed for hiking boots and remove any fit sloppiness within the toe box. I used these insoles for years with my last pair of boots and they are bombproof.

I have not taken these out on the trail yet, but I have been breaking them in on short walks around the neighborhood. So far, I have had no discomfort or hot spots. I will say that the ankle collar fit is a little odd and takes some getting used to. It isn't uncomfortable, just not as supportive as an all-leather alternative would offer.
review.name: Eceptionally good quality

review.itemreviewed: Fugitive GTX Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Backcountry's service and shipping were fantastic.  Boot is/was gorgeous (or was until I began putting miles on them). Great fit. Great ankle support. I simply refrain from giving it a perfect 5 because Asolo has a better boot and I own better boots. 
Not a boot for wet or muddy trails. Absolutely not the best for getting silly off trail. 
If its your style to wear hiking boots to pick up chicks, this is your boot, Mr SmellGood
review.name: Almost Great
comment: Kristopher my crotchety friend...I love  your review and I'm stealing your 'Mr. SmellGood'. I have a friend with a jeep that has never gone off-roading...these seem perfect.
What are the boots you recommend?!

name: Fugitive GTX Wide Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a nice hat, but it comes in a one-size-fits all format, and it was too small for most of the adults in my family. While we are a relatively large headed people, we are way out in the tail of the distribution. Furthermore the hat did not fit several spouses, so this can't just be blamed on my family's abnormally large heads or something. I would say that if you have an average size head or smaller this might fit, but anything above average will be a tight squeeze.
review.name: Nicely made hat, but small

review.reviewBody: I love hiking and always need a hat. This will work perfectly! Love the colors too. Bought one for myself and another to gift.

review.reviewBody: my very first bucket hat! and I love it. everyone who sees it loves it. I just wish it can have an option for a longer back for hikes so that the neck is protected

review.reviewBody: I have a condition that forces me to have my head covered most hours but I've had issues with most hats this is the first one I can see myself using without issues.

review.reviewBody: I need a shoe that has more cover in other words I can walk in dirt and rain and not worry about my feet getting dusty or wet. This particular shoe is nice for summer . Now I need better coverage with the same sole. Do you have anything that might work?
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair of Hokas from Fleet Feet a few months ago, the Gaviota 5s, I exchanged them 2 months in because the back cushion was fully down since purchase. I do not shove my feet into my shoes, I use a shoe horn. These are my 4th pair of hokas in my life and I never had problems until now. When exchanged, the new ones do the same thing but I can't exchange them again. The design is awful not having the cushion connected. I take really good care of my shoes so there is no reason for the cushion to slide down just from basic daily walking. Especially shoes MEANT for walking! These are extremely expensive to be so useless and feel unstable when walking because there is no cushion to help keep it over the heel. There has to be a better design
review.name: Heel cushion isn't connected

review.reviewBody: I have several foot issues and these shoes are great for them love love
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for working at an indoor range where I stand on concrete for upwards of 12 hours a day. I only work 1-2 days a week and the toe of these shoes have started to come unglued and the fabric has a hole at the toe. While they were great to wear, for the amount of money I am really disappointed in the quality.
review.name: Lasted 4 months of light wear

review.reviewBody: Where are the BRIGHT colors? The colors you put out are too too light l!! They get dirty too fast! Manufacture and sell more choice of colors.
review.name: Colors Needed!!

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair because they were recommended for plantar fasciitis. My condition has improved! I'm convinced.
review.name: I would buy these again.

review.reviewBody: Foot neuropathy and require orthotics. Gaviota 5 has enough room for the orthotics as well as offering a soft foot landing.
review.name: Absolutely

review.reviewBody: Come on guys, I LOVE my Gaviota's, but I also bought them because I soooo love crazy wonderful colorful shoes. What, some people complain that you don't have dull, boring colors and you cave into them and forget the customers that buy these because of the Crazy lovable colors??? PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE Stop with the ugly ugly white shoes and bring back the COLOR!!!!
review.name: WHERE ARE THE COLORS????

review.reviewBody: I have extreme plantar fasciitis, over pronation and flat arches. These shoes are the only thing I have found to give me relief. As long as I'm wearing them, my feet feel ok. Anything else has made them hurt. They have great support, cushion on the heels and stability is good. My ankles don't roll inward. Hope they help someone else!
review.name: #1 shoe for flat feet, over pronation & PF

review.reviewBody: This shoe (I bought a wide) has a beautiful tow box of a barefoot shoe, a zero drop feel, and yet just enough cush to protect your heel and back. I had misdiagnosed broken bones in my foot that turned into bone marrow edema and Mortons Neuroma. The foot then developed Complex Regional Pain Syndrom through all the PT they put me through before healed. Pair that with 8 ruptured disc's, a severed ACL, and Ehlers Danlos and you've got a MESS! IN COMES THE GAVIOTA 5. THE PERFECT SHOE. BUY IT, (or 5)
review.name: Toe box of a barefoot shoe

name: Gaviota 5 Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Lodge Matte Finish Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I just received the Lodge Hooded Jacket. I believe I have been looking for the perfect coat for years and I have found it!  The size guide is fairly accurate.  I am 5’5”, 125 pounds, chest 36/37, waist 31/32, hips 37/38 and sleeve length 31/32. I ordered the size small and it fits perfectly.  I live in the Midwest with winter temperatures averaging 20-30 degrees F. This jacket is extremely warm and the hood is well insulated. I recommend the matte black and the red sleeve emblem is very smart looking. It’s true that you get what you pay for and quality certainly has its price. Do yourself a favor and buy this jacket before you buy three other cheaper coats that won’t remotely compare. My only regret is that I didn’t just buy this jacket sooner. P.S. you can’t beat the lifetime guarantee. Thank you Canada Goose and Backcountry. You made my day.
review.name: Larry

review.itemreviewed: Lodge Matte Finish Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I received this jacket in a plastic bag and the package seem cheap. Once I wore it, I felt the material was too puffy and note a slim fit as advertised. I?m 6?0 and 190 athletic build and the large size didn?t feel right. I ordered the red mate but it?s not really a mate and it?s more like a lifeguard red which didn?t look as expected. 
I sent it back and considering other options.
review.name: Below expectations

review.itemreviewed: Lodge Matte Finish Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice warm jacket with a fit that?s on point. Slimmer fit and jacket falls at about the waist line. I ordered a size large and I?m roughly 200 pounds and 5?7ft. It fits very well for what it?s designed to do. Love the 2 side pockets and can?t live without the front zippered pocket. The matte finish makes it not stand out from other Canada Goose products which was a plus for me. The hood could also use some work. It?s a jacket I?m very comfortable wearing around town and in the house but not one that I would grab off the rack to go backpacking or do anything serious outside.
review.name: Great coat with little flash

review.itemreviewed: Lodge Matte Finish Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I just received this jacket in size M and color black. This is the new model 5078m. So did anyone who purchase this jacket came in a Canada goose  box? Mine came inside a Canada goose plastic wrapper. Also is the Canada goose patch on the left arm supposed to be centered or is it supposed to lean more towards the front. Mine is more towards the front. And lastly, does anyone else have a tag labeled 180/100Y under the size tag with in my case is M/M. Thank you.
review.name: Nice jacket but is mines fake?
comment:
this is real deal. 

it says this is an official Authorized Retailer according to Canada Goose. Please dont misinform customers. 

'THIS SITE IS A CANADA GOOSE
AUTHORIZED ONLINE RETAILER'

No box, plastic wrap, can?t tell much about the logo but it also says 180/100Y. 
Not sure what all that means

review.itemreviewed: Lodge Matte Finish Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great purchase. Only need to buy one of these in your lifetime. Insanely warm and comfortable. Also, very very light and the whole thing condenses to a camping pillow if all else ever fails haha. Overall, highly recommend this jacket. Looks much better on yourself than the model in the picture lol, it looks short on the model.
review.name: Canada Goose Lodge Jacket

name: Lodge Matte Finish Down Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Cedars Merino Midweight Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fairly similar to last year's Spruces model (the lavender, black, and blue/green leaf pattern). The cuff at the calf is now just a hem... probably for better stretch. And the waist band now has a drawstring pull. Fit is about the same. 5'7 155, Large fits me like a pleasantly comfortable tight, not stretched skin tight like a spandex sausage, and I do fold down the waistband. Could probably go medium if you wanted a snugger fit but I like the fabric less stretched so it's thicker and warmer, especially if I accidentally dry them. I usually run size 10 relaxed fit. They were warm for alpine skiing and touring last year so I got more.
review.name: Similar to last year's Spruces but --

name: Cedars Merino Midweight Baselayer Bottom - Women's

review.reviewBody: This chair absolutely rocks. I will say, it’s a tad heavy and bulky compared to other camp chairs, HOWEVER, that is because it’s a rocking chair. This wouldn’t be my go to if I needed something to sit on during a multi-day trek. But if I am going to a friend’s for a fire, going car camping, or going to the range for a day, this guy is coming with me.
review.name: Sizable, but fantastic

review.reviewBody: Chair is amazing and even fold up well for its size. I love the adjustable back rest that allows the chair to fit a tall range of people.
review.name: Excellent feel

review.reviewBody: I travel full-time in my Airstream and was looking to replace a GCI rocker and a zero gravity recliner. The Nemo stargazer lets me recline and swing/rock at the same time. It automatically adjusts as you lean back and sit up. It also gives you a little bit of lumbar support, which is an added bonus. Getting in and out is easy when you get the technique down. I’m very happy with this purchase and will be using it a lot.!
review.name: Sooo comfortable!!!

review.reviewBody: I recently bought this chair as a dedicated car camping chair and it is easily the most comfortable camp chair I’ve ever owned. I just got back from taking it on a week of elk hunting and this chair was a huge help in my recovery each evening. I really enjoy how much this chair reclines and if you find a good spot to rest your feet, like a cooler, you may as well be in your easy chair at home. I’m also super impressed how small this chair packs down for how comfortable and supportive this chair is. Highly recommend this chair.
review.name: Most comfortable camp chair

review.reviewBody: I love this chair, but I wish they offered a version with metal connection terminals (for the poles) instead of nylon or whatever plastic material they use. I feel like this chair would last forever if the two connection terminals were metal, except for maybe needing to replace the seat portion every few years. I say this because one of the nylon/plastic terminals broke on the first Stargaze chair I owned, which NEMO replaced, but it was disappointing to discover there’s no way to replace these parts. That meant throwing away the entire chair because of one tiny part. If these parts were metal and constructed into two halves (screwed together) it could provide almost indestructible durability, as well as an easy way for users to take apart the connection terminals to self-repair/replace the poles and/or inter-pole bungie cords, and/or the terminals themselves. In addition, I think metal would also provide a huge upgrade to the chair’s stability… because the nylon/plastic connection terminals can begin to loosen/deform over time, making the chair somewhat wobbly.
review.name: Great Chair… but

review.reviewBody: There are LOTS of knockoff camp chairs like this one out there now.  Don't fall for them.  None of them have the build quality and comfort that the NEMO one has.  I bought 3 other ones to try out and this is the one we kept.
review.name: The only one you should buy

review.reviewBody: Had this for 3 years.  Best camp chair ever.  Do you sell a footrest add on?    I want one.  Happy to product test your beta!
review.name: Love this chair!

review.reviewBody: I have had enough, after multiple attempts at purchasing these chairs, and expecting high functionality, I have given up. each of these chairs that I have owned has developed tears in the fabric, near the bottom of the rear support poles and have rendered the 300 dollar chairs useless. I had hoped it was a singular item issue, however it seems to be a design and manufacturing flaw. I have tried to repair the tears and have had no luck in doing so with lasting results. I do not reccomend spending money on these chairs, as they will fail.
review.name: frustrating lack of quality
comment: Thanks for taking the time to leave a review! Sorry to hear that there are issues with the chairs you have. The Stargaze was updated in 2023 and this issue has been addressed in the new design. Our CS team will reach out to you directly to provide warranty info. Thanks for leaving a review of the older model Stargaze!

review.reviewBody: I bring my Stargazer everywhere with me.  It's a 1st gen model and is showing its age but it still works well and I love it.  Easy to set up, tear down and zip up.  My first chair had stitching weakness but Nemo happily replaced, the replacement is great.  The annoying design bits seem taken care of in this current model:  Occasional pinching arm skin at the webbing-slip-joint, the too small of a pillow and a bit more space between the uprights.  Nicely done, Nemo!  I may need to upgrade when I wear out this one!
review.name: My Portable Sanctuary

review.reviewBody: Originally won one of these and now our whole family has one each and they make great gifts.  It's really something you wouldn't necessarily buy for yourself, being a bit pricey--now that I have my own, I totally get it.  Great construction, comfortable and so nice looking, we set them up in our living room for extra seating.   Worth it.
review.name: I Didn't Know I Needed This

name: Stargaze Reclining Camp Chair

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Escapist Top Tube Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Escapist Top Tube Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Escapist Top Tube Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super cool bag. Very well made and waterproof. Found it to be just the right size to stay out of the way. Mounts to both my bikes, but had to make my own velcro straps (easily done). The teal even matches my Yeti!
review.name: Super cool bag. Very well

review.reviewBody: I like the "aero" shape and smaller size, and the material is nice and seems pretty water resistant! Some big room for improvement though: straps do not tie the bag down as strongly as other top-tube bags I have (like Oveja Negra), metal zipper jingles like crazy so I cut it off and reattached the string only straight to the zipper. It's a fine bag, but also feels clear this is Ospreys first attempt at on-bike bags.
review.name: OK bag, room for improvement

name: Escapist Top Tube Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the POC Otocon Race Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love my POC Kortal and Obex… but I can’t stand this helmet. I run a M/L 55-58 in the Kortal and Ovex— Amazing fit; thought it would be the same for the Otocon but not even close. This helmet is so tight to get on. You have to hold the chin straps out and boa tensioner while you put the helmet on otherwise they tuck and fold on themselves up inside the helmet. I’ve never had such an issue and disappointment with a helmet in all my years of moto and mtb. Put your $350 towards a better helmet.
review.name: Such a bummer

review.reviewBody: I was using a kortal race (still have) but wanted a little extra protection so I upgraded to the full face. It's nice and lite and can ride all day with it. If POC fits you well, it's worth it!
review.name: Comfy and lite

name: Otocon Race Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: recommended to me by a thru hiker - these are great
review.name: comfort built to last

review.reviewBody: I'm an avid hiker and love this style. Very comfortable, well-ventilated and stretchy. Decent number of pockets.
review.name: Great hiking pant

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair since they first came out. I still love them. The pockets are in the right spot, cargo pants done right. Very light, very tough, and comfortable.
review.name: The perfect light weight pants.

review.reviewBody: If you're considering buying these pants, I recommend trying them on in-store first. OR has made fitting extremely complicated; it seems every single piece of clothing is a different size. I bought these pants in the same size as my previous purchase 30' , and they are too small.
review.name: OR need to fix the sizing

review.reviewBody: Comfortable fit and a style suitable for hiking or casual wear.
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody: Fishing trip in Oregon on rogue river and hunting in AZ. Fit is perfect. Very quiet. Very breathable. Descent amount of water repellent. Most comfortable hiking pants I’ve owned.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Last years, every time OR does a "new & improved" version, it means "we make it cheaper for us and more expensive for you".  I still have a few original Ferrosi Pants and they are better in every aspect. Having the same fabric, they have zippers on both rear pocket, less bulky vertical hip pocket, better cuff closure, and the same fabric. So, why OR fixes not broken? The answer is simple - to make more profit.
review.name: Just a stripped down version of the original pants

review.reviewBody: For those customers with shorter inseams, 28" or shorter, disregard this product. Backcountry labeled an inseam of 30" as short, which is ridiculous.
review.name: Short is still long
comment: We appreciate your feedback regarding the inseam length of this product. We are reviewing our product descriptions to ensure they are accurate and clear. We have sent you an email to discuss this further.

review.reviewBody:
I got these for my boyfriend who was wanting hiking pants that offered the breathability and stretch needed to go up steel trails. While also looking stylish enough to wear to a restaurant before or after hiking. 

He loves that they are comfortable and stylish enough to wear casually and while traveling yet also hold up to the terrain. 

I hope OR continues to make more colors and stock up on more tall man sizes (34 x 34).
review.name: Perfect pants

review.reviewBody: I really wanted and expected to like these more than I do. The fabric is light, repels light rain and seems comfortable in a pretty wide range of temperatures, but feels very synthetic (I know, it is synthetic, but other synthetic fabrics feel more natural on the skin). The legs are cut very long, so they are kind of baggy at the bottom, and the pockets are designed like jean pockets, so they are difficult to access while wearing a pack, harness or jacket. I bought them from the OR website (great service as always), so I didn't try them before purchasing.
review.name: not a good as I had hoped.

review.reviewBody: Think Lululemon go getter but more padding. Well made and holds an incredible amount of items in an organized way.
review.name: Love this bag!

review.reviewBody: I am going on a trip with my three little dogs. Rather than have all their outdoor stuff in IKEA bag to tote their stuff around in, I was in the hunt for a tote at least as big with a zipper so things weren't spilling out. According to the measurements, this bag should have been bigger overall than the IKEA bag. Unfortunately, I can't fit even half of what was in the IKEA bag into this bag. You can see from the picture of the empty Dakine bag vs a full Dakine bag and it doesn't fit quite a lot still left in the other bag. I'll keep it just because I like it but bummed it's not as big as it says. It says it's 23.5 x 16 x 11in. It's 21x15x 8. I never would have bought it in the first place though if I knew it was still smaller than the bag I have.
review.name: Nice bag but it's not as big as it says.

review.reviewBody: Tore a hole in the arm after a single wear and wash, disappointed. Mass produced thin sweater, think of it as a fashion item rater than a piece of useful gear.
review.name: Thin wool, not durable

review.reviewBody:
First off, I love this sweater so much I bought two of them. It?s warm, fits loose, and has great color. It?s scratchy wool but it?s really not that bad as I wear it in short sleeves most days. I?m a bigger guy and XXL is great. Stays warm yet breathable. 

I?ve had it for maybe 2 months and one of them got caught on my dogs toenail. A thread came out and now it?s ripping across the chest. Maybe that?s just the territory for a wool sweater but I?m bummed it?s already torn. However, I really dig it.
review.name: Awesome Sweater! I question durability

review.reviewBody: Having had terrible cold weather experiences in the Alps, Mt. Shasta (CA) and during an Arctic blast in NYC, I purchased this medium-light weight sweater for those sub 30 degree days as a mid layer to my overcoat or ski shell. XL perfect fit for my 5'-11," 225 Lb. weightlifter frame 48" chest, arm length too. Also the wool did not bother my bare arms, although in cold places I plan to wear a long sleeve Dri-Fit tshirt or thermal. Wife loved the color.
review.name: The Bomb

review.itemreviewed: Eldo Mid LTH GV Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Some years back I had the Asolo Fugitive boots.  They were a bit heavy (but awesome) and eventually I switched to trail runners (mostly Altras), then went for a light boot (Keens).  Those Keens might have contributed to my slipping on rocks and tearing my MCL, after recovering from which I decided to dedicate my footwear to Vibram soles, which I believe make a difference on rock.  The Altras had it but kept falling apart.  So now I've got these boots and I absolutely LOVE them because they have the Vibram sole, the support of a boot, longevity better than trail runners, and they are Asolo.  So it's like a lightweight cousin which reminds me of my old Fugutives but lighter weight.
review.name: My favorite boots of all time

review.reviewBody:
I had expected these pants to be kind of stiffer than they are; instead they are super soft with no real structure to them.  They are incredibly comfy.  The material is very stretchy and the legs are full.  They are a little baggy.  The color is nice; obviously green without being obnoxiously green.  They pair well with an orange shirt (or pretty much any neutral color).

I could wear them every day in the winter.

The belt has a fairly bold pattern.  I'm neutral on it.  My shirts tend to cover the belt line so nobody will ever see it; I'd probably prefer it didn't have one built in and that it had belt loops instead.

Back pockets close with velcro.. I don't dig that - id prefer a zipper or something less abrasive on my hand.  I'm glad they close though becuase stuff would fall out due to the relaxed material.

Front pockets opening is a little too small - my hands are a little bigger than average and they don't slide right into these pockets.

Id say these run true-to-size or maybe a little big.
review.name: Unstructurd and totally comfortable

name: Corduroy Venture Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: After weeks of research, I chose this bag as a replacement for my old Solo backpack that I had for nearly 8 years. After about two weeks of use it has shown its usefulness and resilience during my daily commute. The storage capability is nearly perfect for what I bring daily. Here’s to another 8+ years of use!
review.name: Very Nice Upgrade!

review.reviewBody: Water holder not very durable.  Front pocket flops and only has one zipper,.
review.name: Marginal

review.reviewBody: I am really enjoying my new backpack. I wanted something for weekend travel and it's great. There's so many pockets for things. I love the water proof pocket. And the water bottle holde is the best I've ever seen! It's so stretchy that it holds my Yeti. I would def recommend this backpack
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I was in the market for a new backpack after my last Thule (which lasted 10 years of school and travel) was retired. I tried two other brands which were great but I was missing the organizational pockets. I found that I really need lots of pockets of different sizes for my daily work bag and that EnRoute was the perfect bag for me. I tried the other 2 brands for a week each, but compared to a week with the EnRoute it was far and away the winner. I know this brand is worth the money and will last long, I don’t know why I ever tried to find a replacement for my last Thule bag outside of this brand!
review.name: Thule Fan For Life

review.reviewBody: This is our second Thule backpack. After my husband used the first one for 15+ years I bought the new one for my son.  It is durable and high quality product.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: Plenty of room for work and life stuff while not being too bulky to carry around. Perfect for my everyday needs!
review.name: Love this bag!

review.reviewBody: Holds a great combo of business and pleasure and nicely separates them:)
review.name: Great Bag!

review.reviewBody:
When looking for a new backpack, I was particular in my desired features. First, as a commuter, I wanted pockets on the fronts and sides that would be easily accessible on the go. Second, as a student, I wanted the inner organization to facilitate use of the backpack contents. Third, as someone with chronic shoulder pain, I wanted the backpack to be ergonomic and comfortable. 

My prior backpack was much loved but could not be repaired. In its newest iteration, however, the designers had removed many of the smaller pockets in the main laptop compartment. In addition, other backpacks currently on the market have internal organization pockets in smaller compartments toward the front of the pack. 

Such design decisions created some problems in my eyes. First, if I pull out my laptop, I will usually want to also retrieve a mouse, charging cable, pencil, notepad, etc. Thus, moving smaller pockets away from the main compartment where the laptop is stored means I will have to open and close multiple zippers when retrieving and/or stowing the contents (inefficient). 

Second, loading the internal organization pocket fully when it’s located in a front compartment can pull the front of the pack forward, especially when the backpack’s main compartment is also open. This creates a situation where, if the flap flops forward, the contents of the internal organization pocket can fall out. The pocket placement also shifts the pack’s center of gravity away from the person, which is not ideal when carrying the backpack for longer periods of time. 

To make a long story short, the Thule EnRoute addresses all my concerns. The placement of the organization panel in the main compartment not only facilitates easy retrieval/storage, but also ensures most of the weight stays close to the body. The back panel and straps are comfortable, and I appreciate the elastic bands that let you stow away excess strap. Finally, the interesting green color helps people to locate me when I am meeting them for the first time on rotations, interviews, etc. There are other thoughtful features that make this pack a joy to use but this review is already too long as is, so I will stop here and suggest you peruse the Thule website. 

If pressed, my only concerns would be 1) not having a waist strap (but this can be easily addressed by buying one separately and adding to the backpack) and 2) this backpack setting my standards so high that I would be concerned if Thule goes out of business. I hope I will never have to replace this backpack, but if I do, I will be looking to Thule again. Thank you to Thule for continuing to pioneer and elevate standards in modern backpack design.
review.name: Everything I wanted in a backpack

review.reviewBody: Easy to use organization for a work/life bag. Simple clean style makes it easy for the office. The ‘life’ section is great for gym clothes, lunchbox, etc. Very comfortable to wear also. Only complaint (very small) is I wish the ‘Work’ section of the pack unzipped a little further to allow a bigger opening for items at the bottom. This is a very small compliant and would encourage anyone who needs a work/life bag with low key appearances to buy one.
review.name: Great organizer, strong materials, well made

review.reviewBody: I use it as my everyday carry and love all of the netted pockets on the exterior. 2 for water and one upfront for dirty clothes is plenty to store stuff you don't want inside your bag. The interior has plenty space. I'd say the only flaw is that the interior pockets are a bit floppy and possibly has too many pockets. I like the sunglasses hardcover up top to store your glasses in.
review.name: Great all around bag

name: EnRoute 26L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
If you have wide feet the Instinct is the way to go. The forefoot is very wide compared to most shoes and heel is mid volume. It's a great generalist, kind of fills similar niche as like Anasazi VCS  but more modern and totally different fit

I'm a 11.5 or 12 and got them in 44.5 first, then switched to 45. I think they work better when sized for comfort with mostly flat toes than with a curl
review.name: Workhorse for fat feet

review.reviewBody:
I must've tried on 20 pairs before finding these! I realized I need the LACE rather than  velcro since my heels are quite narrow, and will slip out with any other type of shoe. (I found La Sportivas to have the largest heel cup by far. I've had 3 other Scarpas and they are the best fit for me).  

I upgraded from the Scarpa Boostic and these were definitely a more aggressive fit, yet they never felt uncomfortable even on the first try. Immediately they felt sturdier and stickier. They are slightly less flexible in the middle which gave me the stability I needed on chips and edges. My toe hooks improved a thousand percent with the rubber toe box. And the clincher - they don't slip out on even sharp heel hooks (which I do a lot) like most other shoes I've tried. They are also very comfortable, I can wear them an entire session without taking them off. I've used them 1-2x / week for 2 years and still going. Note that I mostly boulder indoors, but I can see these holding up well outside.
review.name: Sticky bouldering shoe for narrow heels

review.reviewBody:
I wear size 8.5-9 street shoe/ sportiva tx3/ 42 Miura vcs(baggy but comfy). 
     Okay so due to sizing availability I bought the Instinct VS in 41.5 and Instinct lace in 41 and the sportiva Solution in 41. These are my try-on impressions. 
Instinct VS 41.5- perfect tight fit. Foot slides in and heel cup is tight. Toes slightly curled. 
Instinct Lace 41- Foot slides in with some hefty pulling on heel loops. Heel cup tight af. No dead space. Toes curled up. Pain. 
Solution 41- slips on nicely. Tight in toe box. Dead space in heal. Farting noise when walking around lol. Nope.  

I sent the instinct vs and solutions back. The instinct lace is really tight, but I wanted a tight shoe after not going tight enough on my Miuras. I was a little worried the VS would break in and not be quite tight enough. Anyways hope this helps. I?m psyched to climb in them and I?ll update this after they?re broken in. 

My gear head Robert was very helpful as well!
review.name: Initial Comparison
comment: Thanks for the awesome review and great feedback on the sizing here Mitch! I hope these bad boys help you send some awesome routes!

They are great with jeans, leggings, skirts, anything!! I've even thrown one over a dress when it was chilly! These are my go-to tops!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! The color is light but not making me look pale; it also goes great with navy blue slacks or jeans. Must have in your closet for casual wear but still looks Stylist!

review.reviewBody: Top-notch jacket. Sizing is slightly smaller than my other BD gear so keep that in mind especially if you're trying to layer underneath.
review.name: Top-Notch Jacket

review.reviewBody: Using it on lighter Nordic days. Love the breathability and comfort. Fit is great.
review.name: Awesome Jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket performs in quality and durability along the best in its class from competitors. From hail to downpour to blizzard to lite mist, this jacket protects, I’ve had ice crystallized to the entire exterior and I’ve had rain beaded for hours on end, this jacket fits well and is simple and practical. It leans heavy on the breathable side which is amazing for spring through fall ascents. It also makes a great daily driver to keep in the car for the rainy season. After wearing a backpack for a few months the dwr on the shoulders wore away, to be expected and self maintainable. A must have jacket in the quiver.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a light weight shell that I could use as an outermost layer for bad weather days. Though haven’t had a chance to test them for how waterproof they are. Delighted with the size, fit and finish. I am 5’8” and 154 lbs and size medium is a perfect fit with room to spare for layering. Love the color (Indigo). Overall very happy with the purchase.
review.name: Perfect light weight shell

review.reviewBody: Waterproof jacket that works, good, slimmer fit. Not as stretchy as expected, and breathability is average (compare to Goretex Active for example). However, for the price it is a decent rain wear that I would recommend.
review.name: Good rain wear for the price

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight and packable. Love the weight as it’s a perfect backpacking, climbing, and more as an add on layer. Bomber waterproofing too. I’m 6’0 and large is perfect
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is extremely well designed with its simplicity and elegance. The BDdry fabric is top quality and will keep you dry even through the worst storms. The true highlight of this jacket is the helmet-compatible hood and the associated cinch. I also have the Recon insulated shell that uses the same design and lI ove it. It makes the hood useable with and without a helmet. BD knocked it out of the park with this one. 

I am 5'9" and 180 pounds and bought a medium and it fits perfectly with light clothing underneath.
review.name: Stellar Jacket

name: Fineline Stretch Shell - Men's

review.reviewBody: Very comfy. Holds one in and is supportive. Like the sand color. I sized up to a medium, as I’m usually a S.
review.name: As advertised

review.reviewBody: I have several of the All Day Free Fly leggings in various colors and wear them all the time! I just tried the pocket legging and am wondering what took me so long - the pockets are deep enough to hold a phone and strong enough to not sag while the phone is inside the pocket. A win for me! Love the comfort they afford and how nicely they wash! A winner!
review.name: Buttery soft comfort

review.reviewBody: These leggings are perfect with side pockets. Soft and buttery they wash nicely and maintain their shape. I wish that you carried a jet black color all of the time. I own many pairs.
review.name: Amazing Leggings

review.reviewBody: Black Sand is a beautiful shade of black. At 135 lbs, 5'2", size small goes on easily and fits snugly, comfortably. Love it and will buy more.
review.name: The Women's All Day Pocket Legging fits and feels wonderful!

review.reviewBody: These leggings are so soft and breathable. Free fly has a customer for life!
review.name: Love these leggings

review.reviewBody: Not a fan of the seam going down the back of the leg or the unfinished hem. Otherwise they are comfortable and wished I liked them more.
review.name: Not a fan

review.reviewBody: I LOVE the feel of these leggings! They are a staple in the cooler months for me!
review.name: Buttery soft is not a lie!

review.reviewBody: It’s like not wearing anything. They are so comfortable
review.name: Buy. You won’t regret it

review.reviewBody: LOVE THEM!!!Wish you would have a sale on them-lol
review.name: So soft!!!

review.reviewBody: I was questioning the price, but decided to try them. After 10 minutes, I realized the fit and comfort was great. It feels like you’re wearing nothing. Next would the waistband roll down? I wore around the house for about an hour and it never rolled down. Next day I wore them while doing yard work. The fit the whole day was perfect, waistband never rolled down, and material never lost its shape. Day three I decided to work around the garage and again they still fit like the first time I put them on, never lost shape, and No, the waistband still has not rolled down! If you’re still deciding, I suggest giving them a try. I am very happy with them and will be buying more. My only issue is the pocket is kind of narrow for my phone, but it easily stretches to fit.Recommend A+++
review.name: Definitely worth it!

review.reviewBody: This waterproof fishing license holder from Simms is exactly what you could want it to be. It holds your license(s) easily and neatly, if they’re folded over a few times. The seal at the top helps to ensure it’s closed and it has a small clip attached to a small lanyard and Velcro on the back of the holder. I keep mine in a tackle bag that I always take with me fishing so I know where it’s at.
review.name: Gets The Job Done

review.reviewBody: Main component is well done. My document is safe and waterproof. However I would improve on the plastic clamp. Does not appear very secure.
Had an issue with the clip on the original. Simms quickly replaced it.
review.name: License holder

review.reviewBody: Nice display on front of waders. No way you can lose your license.  Very sturdy velcro and tie down clip
review.name: Perfect accessory

review.reviewBody: Just what I needed for my license don’t have to look for it every time I get checked
review.name: Good price

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit, been wearing it everyday so far holding up the way it should!!!
review.name: Perfect License ID holder

review.reviewBody: Does what is supposed to do.  Fish and Game even comments on it when we get boarded:(

description: Buy the SRAM Force/Red AXS Power Meter Spider - 2024 online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Force/Red AXS Power Meter Spider - 2024
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM Force/Red AXS Power Meter Spider - 2024 online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is the only power meter I have had, so I do not have anything to compare with.  That being said, it seems pretty good and gives you  a left right percentage (ie: 51%/49%).  Have had it for about three months now with no issues.
review.name: Seems good to me

review.reviewBody:
Easy to install, several you tube videos available.
Connects with my Garmin 840, IPhone easily and you dont need a degree in computer science
Only other:
It could have included a better set of instructions for effective use. This is my first Power Meter and I am not sure how to use it. Effectively
review.name: Great Piiece of equipment

review.reviewBody: Purchased as an add-on to new Pivot gravel bike (once the price dropped from $600 to $450).  Installation very easy as long as you have T20 torx bit to change out the existing spider.  You also need 8 mm hex and torque wrench to remove the AXS crank assembly.  Install instructions in the box are non existent, but plenty of videos on you-tube.  This powermeter weighs 100 g more than the standard Force AXS spider.  Connecting to both AXS app and my Garmin 830 was very easy.  Nice that the app is available for any firmware updates.  I have not done any accuracy comparison to other power meter such as vector pedals or trainer, but directionally the readings seems good.  There is estimated left/right balance if you see value there.  My prior experience with crank based meters is they are simple, set and forget, and with the new price the AXS version seems like good value.  4 stars because of need to find my own instruction videos, and would have liked smaller weight penalty which may be unrealistic at 100 g!
review.name: Easy installation, works great so far

name: Force/Red AXS Power Meter Spider - 2024

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: The blue color is beautiful and I really wanted to love this top but the fit is odd. I ordered a large so I could layer it. The length is perfect (below hip) but the arm length and fit is off. They are way too long (2 inches beyond my fingers) and very tight from my biceps down to forearm. I am muscular and not fatty. The fabric is rough next to my skin.
review.name: Odd fit

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Flattering, well-made, lovely color, warm yet not bulky
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am an endurance rider (horses) and high altitude skier. This shirt is super lightweight and WARM ! The zip neck makes for comfort in a wide range of temperatures. The zipper chest pocket is easy to get into while in motion ( which I usually am ). I am constantly seeking the most versatile clothes for wilderness fun. I bought 5 of these !!!
review.name: Packs Most Punch in Smallest Package

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This newer version of the women's Vigor is NOT like last year. It is much much tighter in the arms which in turn makes it not very comfortable at all...please go back to the old style! I usually wear a size M (which is what I got) but when I measured it to my M from last year it was almost 3/4" more narrow. I will say OR Customer Support was super about processing a return - very helpful!
review.name: Super tight arms

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Initially purchased in large as I wear large in most OR shirts and that was what the size chart suggested. WAY too tight! The arms were super tight, the shirt was tight across the chest, and slightly loose at the waist. Sent it back for an XL. Fit better in the arms and chest, but the waist was super baggy and a bit long overall. However, I love the fabric, color, and how the shirt performs when I am working up a sweat. It breathes super well, and doesn't stay damp very long. Great for XC skiing!
review.name: Love it but the Sizing is Off

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This mid layer is great for fall days when you're out but not very active as well as when it's colder but you're hiking or moving a bit more. I've been hiking in this as a mid layer under a puffy in temperature down to 20 and been comfortable. It also looks good as a stand alone. Highly recommend
review.name: Comfy, warm and looks good

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super warm and love the color. Wore this as a single layer while running in 30F and it was perfect. My only problem with the grid fleece is that it's a terrible lint and pet hair trap. Any pet hair or lint will attach itself to it and I spend way too much time with a lint roller on it and it's difficult to get it all.
review.name: A great active layering piece

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Matched with the cirque 2 pants. Gf likes the look and how comfortable they w
review.name: Gf is happy with it!

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Sweater is comfy, light weight and a great base level for layering or one its own for slightly cool weather. Only con is after just several wears and one wash it is really pilling.
review.name: Comfy, warm light weight, showing signs of wear

review.itemreviewed: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love OR's fleece. I have many - full zip. Hoodies. 1/4 zip. They are all size small. I am 5'6", small bust. I don't have Popeye arms and this top was so so tight I could barely get my arms through the sleeves. Sadly, I need to return.
review.name: Great top, but size is way off

name: Vigor Grid Fleece Quarter-Zip Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Thule x Tepui Explorer Kukenam 3 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: x Tepui Explorer Kukenam 3
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule x Tepui Explorer Kukenam 3 online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Not sure yet. It’s a gift for my son who is in Kuwait in the Army, coming home in 2 weeks to celebrate Xmas !
review.name: Haven’t opened it yet. But the box looks good!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this at the beginning of the pandemic and we haven't stopped using it since! The kids and I have been on several roadtrips and the roof top tent has never disappointed. The mattress seems thin when you look at  it but we found that is very comfortable. It fits three people comfortably and keeps you warm. We have a great rain fly that keeps the tent nice and dry that also works for keeping the tent cool. 
The setup is fast and easy; easy enough that my teen can setup and takedown by herself!
As a family of 4 we often camp with a small ground tent and the rooftop tent. It's the perfect setup for us. Being on top of the car, you can camp in RV sites(closer to the bathroom).
review.name: Great for road trips with kids

review.reviewBody:
This is our first Roof Top Tent and we have been blown away by the Kukenam.   The tent is very comfortable and fairly easy to put up and down.  The installation was okay overall, I found the instructions decent.  

When I ran into issues I opened a support ticket with Thule and they stood behind the product.  Support was fairly quick, understood my issue, and quickly resolved it by sending me the needed part.

Solid 5 out of 5 stars for this tent and Thule for standing behind their products with good support.
review.name: Great Tent,  Outstanding Customer Support

review.reviewBody: We got the Thule Tepui Explorer tent this summer to explore New England with our 1-year-old puppy more often and could not recommend it enough! It was super easy to install and is faster to set up than a regular tent. On our first night trying it out in Acadia, there was a big rainstorm that came through and we stayed warm and dry in the tent the whole night. The mattress is comfy and roomy, too - it made a great first travel bed for our dog, who didn't want to leave in the morning!
review.name: Can't recommend it enough!

review.reviewBody: I have been on the lookout for a rooftop tent for the last 6 months. I was convinced that I needs a hardshell.. but thankfully I came across this tent and decided to do it.  Between the incredible price point and a trusted brand I went for it, and I'm so happy I did! It's exactly what I was hoping for and more. You can't beat the price for what you get. The only downsize I have found is the ladder tends to dent a little when it's all folded up. I'm thinking I can remedy this by putting in rubber strips. Overall it's a great tent and worth it!
review.name: Worth it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s a fast setup time in comparison to similar styled tents I’ve tried. The construction is great and it endures the elements really well. I’ve camped in the rain and it’s kept me dry. If you’re stuck between this and the 2 person variation, I would say spend that extra amount of money to get more space, you won’t regret it. I don’t have any complaints when it comes to the construction or ease of use but I will say that the mattress is okay at best. That’s very common on any roof top tent brand. I upgraded to a HEST memory foam mattress and now it's SO comfortable and spacious. Overall it’s a great roof top tent in its category and I would recommend it for people with Mid sized SUV’s, Sedans, etc. Eventually I would love to try Thule’s wedge styled roof top tent when I upgrade to a bigger vehicle.
review.name: An incredible roof top tent

review.reviewBody: Easy to assemble, strong against harsh weather, super cool and super easy on a daily basis.
review.name: Great Product, Love it

review.reviewBody:
I've taken this tent out a couple of times into the Colorado wilderness and it's been great so far.

The setup was straight forward if you follow the instructions. All of the parts needed came in the box.

It fit on the roof of my Jeep perfectly and didn't block trunk access. Opening the tent up and getting it camp ready only took a few minutes.

My only gripe is that the description says year round, and the mattress that comes with the tent is uncomfortable.
We camped in the mountains where the temperatures reached the mid 20's at night and it was very cold if not for the proper sleeping bag and a heat source.
Non-freezing nights are very comfortable with an additional mattress pad.
review.name: Great size, simple setup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As someone who camps solo, having a rooftop tent that is easy to set up without assistance was important to me! It’s so easy to set up and take down, and only takes 5-10 minutes for each!
review.name: So easy to set up!

review.reviewBody: Purchased this a couple months back. Has performed awesome!! I have a 22 Subaru forester wilderness and it is such a great accommodation for camping. Assembly was easy, everything is well thought out by Thule. Mattress is a little firm but I like that. Took 2-3 mpg off but not bad at all. Love the versatility and ease of set up/tear down. Couldn’t be happier with this thing. I purchased the single shoe bag to go with this and it was well worth it. Ready to camp any day/anytime/any where. Even did great through a wicked rain storm! You will not be disappointed with this set up.
review.name: Best bang for the buck RTT!

name: x Tepui Explorer Kukenam 3

review.reviewBody: These aren’t my usual every day shoe, but have worn them for multiple days in a row and have no complaints. I just need to clean and condition my leather a little more often, but even with my slight neglect these are holding up crazy well, and are perfectly molded to my feet.
review.name: 4 years down, onto more!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] beautiful boots that are made in America. I'm usually between size 8.5 & 9. ordered 9. fit is good. thought they'd require some breaking in but first wear was most of the day with no issue. lasting quality boots that won't be in a landfill in a couple of years.
good collaboration Faherty!
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody:
A gift from my boss!  These boots are head turners, my boss and I were headed overseas and he’s walking toward me in the Airport, the rich color of the boots jumped out at me.  Just beautiful, well my farewell gift was my very own pair.  2 1/2 years later and they look like old money!!! 
I will get the black ones next year.
review.name: Too Long but it’s worth it!
comment: We are delighted to hear that you love your boots so much that you want another pair! We hope you enjoy them just as much or more.

review.reviewBody: I got these used, otherwise I would have returned them. They were essentially brand-new. The craftsmanship is great, the leather quality is great, I like that they're made in the US. I have a very high arch and a narrow foot. The tongue of the boot only opens out like an inch- I couldn't get my foot in them due to my arch. I've never seen a tongue like that- it basically is just there for decoration rather than to offer any adjustment. Rather than try to resell, I slit the tongues along the side stitching open about 3 inches to be able to get my foot in them. That worked. However,  as I said, I have a very narrow foot, and they felt like they were cutting off my circulation, they were SO tight. I bought my usual shoe size (8) and have never had to deviate from that size. Additionally, the stitching at the bottom of the tongue is RIGHT where my arch is highest. After days of "leather stretching spray" (which I found out is just isopropyl alcohol and water...) and putting them on for as long as I could stand (maybe only 15 minutes at a time) they have now gotten into a somewhat wearable state. I will concede that they DID stretch out along the sides, but I am still fighting with the stitches along the arch. Because that is stitched, I don't know how much that will stretch upwards. I want to love them. Maybe I will grow to love them as I wear them more. But had I known any of this- that I literally had to cut the leather by 3 inches to get my foot in it- I would not have bought them and I would have returned them had I bought them new. I'm going to keep trying because I have them already, and now can't resell them because I cut the leather. I hope my review helps someone else with a high arch like me- be warned! I was able to make it work, but I wish I didn't have to do that.
review.name: Not for people with high arches!!
comment: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear about the lack of comfort you've received in your boots. I will reach out to our product design team to see if we can make upgrades to provide a lasting comfort and a sturdy build.

review.reviewBody: I purchased a a pair of these 8 years ago and they are still going strong.  With proper care over the years they still look as good as new all this time later.  They do get some nice patina where the laces cross, and have some character from being worn.  They are my go to boots on most days, with my black pair being the other.  They are also 8 yrs old and going strong. Love these boots!
review.name: Durable for the long run!

review.reviewBody: Bought these boots for horseback riding, but wear them everywhere!  Best boots I’ve ever owned.  IF I ever wear them out, I’ll get another pair immediately.  Comfortable, true to size, can wear them all day long and then some.
review.name: Best boots ever!
comment: Thank you for your comments and taking the time for leaving us this great review.  We hope to continue serving you in the future!

review.reviewBody: Got these in amber harness wide width, my second of three pair of RW’s and truly my favorite boot ever! The fit is perfect. Wide actually fits like a wide (unlike my moc toes). Not to mention a truly beautiful boot. Wish black was also offered in wide. I am disappointed more styles aren’t, there are many more I’d like to own!
review.name: Best boot I own!
comment: Thank you for your feedback and suggestions. I hope in the future this will be something we offer!

review.reviewBody:
I finally took the plunge in buying these a bit before Christmas 2022 (about 6 months from the time of posting this) after saving up funds for quite awhile.
Absolutely no regrets. I've been wearing these almost daily since I got them for going out, or for work (long days of standing and some walking), and they've helped to correct some foot damage/pain some cheap tennis shoes caused. Worth it for that alone, and they still seem to have a very solid and supportive sole unlike the tennis shoes that barely lasted six months. 

I feel a lot of people would shy away due to the higher price tag, but when it comes to a product that costs a bit more but will last much, much longer and can be resoled and fixed up it's definitely worth it. Less money lost, and less trash in the landfill. 
Not to mention they're a U. S. made shoe.

One thing I would suggest though, that if you do go with the boots be sure to measure both feet! If you can make it into a store that would be the best scenario since they have a few ways to measure and possibly try on the boots for feel, but if that isn't possible measure both feet and go with the bigger of the two to avoid one being too tight and rubbing in weird places. Don't go by the "standard" shoe sizing as that can vary. 

Also keep in mind they will be pretty snug for a bit until they've been fully broken in. After that it's a very comfy fit with a bit of wiggle room depending on how thick your socks are.

All in all would recommend. Love my boots and I'm sure I will for years to come!
review.name: Love these boots!
comment: Hi,  we love reading reviews like yours! It's exciting that your boots are doing the trick for you! We can't wait to continue serving you.

review.reviewBody: I remember it took some doing to break these boots in but it was well worth it. They fit like a glove and 6 years in, I still wear them all the time. They’re due to be resoled but still have good years left in them. The entry price seems steep, but it’s a bargain for all the miles you’ll get out of them.
review.name: 6 years and counting!
comment: This is sweet to heart! I'm so glad your boots have held up and you love them.

review.reviewBody: I bought my Iron Ranger boots two weeks ago and have been slowly breaking them in.  I purchased the D width as the B felt too tight in the tow box.  The right boot is now very comfortable but the left boot is very painful.  The gusseted tongue press into the front of my foot making walking very uncomfortable.  This was something that I did not feel when I walked around the store in the boots.  I will give it another week but I'm not sure how long I can last with this pain.
review.name: Left boot still hurts

name: Iron Ranger Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
So far I've worn this on several rides in the high 40s and low 50s and been very comfortable. The lightweight fabric is warmer than I expected before I wore it. It's moderately wind-resistant. I like the quarter-zip, which has helped me avoid overheating on sunny climbs during otherwise chilly rides.

Tailoring is long, narrow, and snug but not binding. I ordered XL for the chest diameter and for the first time in memory I got sleeves longer than my arms (way better than too short!). As you can see in the picture, the shirt-tails are as long as the sleeves, which puts the bottom edge very low on the hips - this definitely goes under my bib straps.
review.name: Comfortable and effective.

name: Active Intensity Zip Top - Men's

description: Buy the Mammut Nordwand Alpine Belay Device online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nordwand Alpine Belay Device
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Nordwand Alpine Belay Device online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Has been durable, light, and nice for guide mode and rappelling
This device is very heavy compared to its competitors, but it is MUCH tougher. This is a great workhorse device.
review.name: A heavy, but rugged tube style device

review.reviewBody: Heat dispersion is great. Won't burn your hand off after a quick belay or rappel.
review.name: Light and cool

review.reviewBody: This is a great durable belay device that can be used in guide mode. It has a really solid feel and it my go-to when I need a tube-style belay device. Definitely overkill for someone just getting into the sport or someone who really only climbs in a gym, but a great to have for anyone who's going on some longer climbs outside.
Needed a belay device for skinny ropes and the Alpine Belay fits the bill.  Works well with thick ropes to but isn't quite as smooth as an ATC.  Works surprisingly well on frozen ropes.

This is my second device of this model. The first developed loose rivets pretty quickly and I retired it. It may have been a manufacturing defect. Despite this initial negative experience, the positive features of this belay device prompted me to try again.  I have given fewer than 10 stars because of my initial bad experience. If I had more confidence in durability, I would give 10.

1. The device has found the best balance between friction and smooth rope feeding that I have seen in a tube-style belay device. Even 10mm ropes feed through well and at the same time, catching a lead fall on sub-9.5mm single ropes is secure and does not require a heavy hand. 
2. It's pretty light
3. The steel doesn't ware as fast as modern alloys. I seem to only get a couple seasons on aluminium alloy belay devices before they are worn enough  for me to retire them. I am very conservative on this and most climbers might not retire their belay devices as quickly as I do, but if the back of the device starts feeling the tiniest bit sharp, I prefer to use something else. 
4. Lowering from above while in autobloc mode works pretty well. About as well as Black Diamond and Petzl alternatives I have tried, maybe a little better. I think it is not as good as DMM's device for this particular use.

Product does what its supposed to. The unit still heats up on rappels, not sure if its more or less compared to  other devices but its a good unit. 

The firm bar makes it hard to release the rope from the belay without taking the whole unit out of the locker, when compared to a Petzl with a wire attachment point but I feel confident in this unit for durability.
review.name: SMooth, runs a good belay

review.reviewBody: The Nordwand Alpine seems to have less friction than other belay devices when belaying from above. My elbows appreciate this! It has good "bite" for rappels and is light and simple. The plate style hangers rather than cables are a bit of an adjustment, but no big deal really.
review.name: Great all around belay device

review.reviewBody: Very light, doesn't heat up on rappel, feeds very smoothly.
review.name: Light, effective, efficient

review.reviewBody: I've used the Reverso and the ATC for years, but decided to get the Alpine Belay this season as my previous device worn out. I'm very happy with it. Functionally, it does what you expect from this category of devices. It works very well with single and double ropes (I've used 8.5 through 9.5mm), has a well balanced catch when lead belaying and just the right amount of friction when rappelling and belaying from the top. Given the different material on the high friction parts (steel), I expect this device to be more durable than my previous. Also, it heats up substantially less on long rappels. One minor downside for me personally: the typical wire of other devices is part of the central metal plate and rigid - hence you can't pull the rope loops and clip/unclip the biner without unclipping the biner from the device as easily.
review.name: Versatile and durable device

name: Nordwand Alpine Belay Device

review.reviewBody:
I normally wear a 6.5/7 in slippers (in the Sanuk brand the size 7 is a bit long for my foot) and 7 in most other shoes so I ordered a 7 in the 'ohana style. I have wide feet so the width was fine and didn't pinch but my heel came right to the edge.  These run a bit short so I recommend ordering one size up than what you would typically wear. I do not wear a size 8 in any kind of shoe but the size 8 fits my foot length much better. 
The quality of the slipper and the feel of the footbed is amazing! My husband owns 6 pairs of various styles and my son has one so our family is a huge fan. The sturdiness of the footbed is great for folks with plantar fasciitis.
review.name: Runs short

review.reviewBody: I love these sandals.  I actually saw them on someone else and asked about them because they look so nice.  I wore my first pair on a Long Beach walk and was really comfortable.  I have sensitive feet and found the support much better than most sandals. They are also easy to rinse without destroying the materials.
review.name: Comfort and Style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these Ohana flip flops about a month ago .. I absolutely love them... they are really soft on the bottom of my feet and have incredible arch support... they are just so comfortable... i am very happy with my purchase
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I always order/buy my sandles a size smaller than what I wear in other shoes like sneakers. This pair must run small as I ordered a size smaller as usual and my foot is almost over the edge of the back. I would suggest ordering your sneaker size. Also the straps seem to have no give to them. I feel like my feet are smashed into them and they are are swelling. Perhaps they just need to be broken in so they have some give.
review.name: Run small

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been wearing these sandals for over 2 weeks now. I absolutely love them. They are so comfortable and lightweight. I'm always hard on my sandals and these definitely have handled the roughness I have put them though.
review.name: Great sandals!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These flip flops are so comforting with a descent arch support. The sandals are also waterproof and made with superb quality materials. I love them and highly recommend them. I have a wide foot and these fit perfect.
review.name: Fantastic Flip Flop

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have tried all the different flips looking for the perfect decent looking shoe.
I need arch support, but do not like the clunkers that are out there.
These shoes are comfy out of the box, no break in period

These look good , feel good, have great arch support ( for flips).
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love flip flops but I can never wear them to long before my feet start to ache. Until I wore the ohana flip flops. They have amazing support and are very comfortable. They are very well made. I have gotten them wet on a couple occasions and that hasn’t made any difference in the comfort or the look of them.
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am absolutely in love with these flip flops They're cute , and very comfortable. They have good arch support, and a soft footbed that has a little give to it , super comfortable I could walk for hours with these flip flops!
review.name: In love with them!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely lov these sandals or flip flops they feel absolutely wonderful on the gpfeet. The support you receive on your heel and the rest of the foot feels amazing so cushiony and comfortable for the feet. It feels like I am getting a massage every time I walk my feet feel so amazing grest cushioned snd almost gel like feel to the feet.  This is great for around the house or even when you go grocery shopping or even a date it just makes your feet feel good I dare say it is even  a adorable design
review.name: What greatness for your feet

review.reviewBody: Standard airlines have a 50lb max on all bags. Why would you make a bag that weighs nearly half the allowable weight limit. So this bag only is able to take lightweight bikes, or pay the extreme airline overweight costs. Do better Dakine.
review.name: Why does this weight over 20lbs

review.reviewBody: Had this bag for 3 years, flew less than a dozen times, and it fell apart. The stabilizing rod busted out of the sleeve, the bottom lost integrity, the corners got totally frayed and the body fabric started pilling (how!?) I emailed EVOC about their warranty, but turns out it doesn't cover baggage mishandling or excessive wear and tear (I'm also outside the 2 year window). Only good thing I can say about it is that the wheels roll nice and quiet. If you fly a lot, this bag isn't for you.
review.name: fell apart

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to transport my girlfriends MEDIUM Ibis Ripmo. I couldn't have been more displeased with how the bike fit in the case. The rear support fit like it was meant for a road bike or something, the fork and rear triangle were practically busting out the ends, and the handle bar angle looked like it was on a mission to scratch the fork stantions. We purchased this because in theory it should fit my XL Hightower as well, which has an even longer wheelbase. I haven't tried it yet, but I have some serious doubts since the medium Ripmo barely fit. The case also likes to teeter back and fourth when sitting on flag ground. Idk how this case got such good reviews. The Dakine is a much better fit for my XL frame, feels very well built and overall my highly preferred choice over the EVOC. I did contact EVOC support requesting an exchange (with me paying the difference) to get the pro version, and they denied my request. The only reason I'm giving this 2 stars, is because the bike did arrive safely. I wasn't confident it would arrive without damage though...
review.name: Poor fit

review.reviewBody:
A smarter man once said something about having to fear just fear itself, or something along those lines.  He was wrong, when we travel with bikes to another country, there are many other realistic fears to come to terms with.  Good thing Evoc has us covered for a relatively low price.  

I'll be real.  I was scared handing off my bike to TSA in this bag.  I wanted to cover it in "FRAGILE, THIS SIDE UP" stickers.  but low and behold - no bent rotors, no broken seat stays, no bent derailleur (i took it off to be safe).  Needless to say, this Evoc bag kept our (yes 2) bikes safe to EU & back to good ol' US of A.  You'll be guaranteed of stressing about your bikes' voyage, but rest assured this bag does what it needs to.
review.name: Euro Trippin'

review.reviewBody: This was first trip with this case. My trail MTB was on heavy side so was overweight by 7 lbs. I think case could use better protection on front corners. Like the overall design though
review.name: Well designed overall

name: Bike Travel Bag
