review.reviewBody: Used it a fair amount. Preferred it on alpine multi pitch for certain belays as a quick point to hitch into. On steeper ice it took me a few times to get comfortable with the setup. Just trained to go through all the motions normally. My wife liked the handle for cleaning the screw seconding. I’m not crazy about the handle as it is constantly sliding out. I like it in the alpine. Not so much on short steep ice. Grivels screws place really well. That isn’t a problem. Honestly just having one in the rack is enough for me. Especially with the price tag. Grivel makes great stuff I’m just not in love with this piece. No regrets on the purchase as it is very useful.
review.name: Ok piece to have in the rack.

hasVariant.name: Doubleshot 2 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Crank Brothers Doubleshot 2 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Use it on a gravel bike that I ride in the city too - perfect for trail > commuting, works exactly like its supposed to.
review.name: Best of both worlds

review.reviewBody:
I've been using either flat pedals or SPD pedals for the last 20+ years of mountain biking but decided to finally upgrade my old SPDs. I won't lie, the sale really pushed my hand.

After 4 rides on them, I was sold...so sold I bought a second set for my other bike.

I use these with a pair of Five Ten shoes and have had no issues. Sometimes a bit sticky to get into the cleat, but I think the thin spacer included should fix that.

Once in, they work great providing fantastic "traction" and float. Easy to get out of as well.

The flat side comes in handy on some of the wet, rooted, and technical climbs here in the Santa Cruz Mountains.
review.name: Great Trail Pedal

review.reviewBody: It does the job and is very easy to release from, which is most important.  But at this price I thought it would be a little easier to click into.  It often takes me 4 or 5 tries to click in which is a hassle on hills and leaves me behind if riding in a group.  I also wish it were a bit lighter.  I like my Shimano clipless a bit better, though not really much difference.
review.name: A bit difficult to click into

review.reviewBody: I have rode clipless many years and love being clipped into my bike! I wanted to get into more downhill style and wanted a pedal that I could clip in and also ride flat. This design is a great idea until you actually use it... The flat side isn't stable because the cleat on your shoe interferes with your grip, and when you want to ride clipless you have to take the extra time to make sure you're on the right side of the pedal to clip in. Overall good quality product but I'd say choose one or the other and stick with it!
review.name: Not quite what I wanted

name: Doubleshot 2 Pedals
Doubleshot 2 Pedals

review.reviewBody:
This is a light weight nimble winter shoe with style and comfort. 

I find it to be warm enough for hiking and kicking around the city. I also wore them on a short snowmobile outing and found my feet to be on the edge of cold but not uncomfortable. The sole has  reasonable grip in icy conditions. 

I would buy these again.

review.reviewBody:
Alloy brake lever is easy to use in the field during transitions (gloves can stay on).  Climbing levels are easy to switch using ski poles and accommodate steeper skin tracks. Toe spring has good pop during engagement and enough clearance under to avoid snow build-up. No plastic on this binding to damage or break. The exception being the brake foundation is plastic. Never pull on the brake arms - always use the metal lever to avoid brake damage. This binding offers reliable retention for aggressive ski mountaineering in all conditions with the expert spring. Reliable ejection from the binding in big falls.  

Great bindings and light for longer more arduous ski summits. One of the best!!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bag to be my everyday pack, with the bonus of having the features of a fly fishing pack for longer days on the river. It has been excellent for both, and then some. 

The padding on the back is incredibly comfortable when worn all day, and that paired with the adjustable shoulder, chest and hip straps have made it easy to adjust it to the growing list of activities I throw at it.

When it comes to fishing, this bag has plenty of tool and accessory compatibility on the shoulder and chest straps, with the little magnet on the right shoulder strap being an excellent spot to place your flies or tools for a minute when changing out your rig on the water. The outer pocket can be accessed horizontally if you rotate the bag around on your right shoulder, much like a sling pack. If you paired this with the Stealth Work Station or Convertible Vest, you could practically live on the river.

This bag's construction is incredibly sturdy. I was worried about there not being any liner on the inside of the bag, especially on the bottom. However, after months of bike commuting on wet streets, scarping past willows and sliding down river banks on the weekends, and even taking some tumbles while using it as a snowboard bag, there is hardly a scratch on the ripstop exterior. In the end, I think the lack of extra liners and padding has kept the bulk down making this pack super light. 

Cant recommend this bag enough, it is absolutely going to become my go to daypack for hikes this spring and summer.
review.name: Awesome, Functional Adventure Pack

name: Stealth 30L Pack

review.reviewBody:
These Dakine Cyclone Wings perform exceptionally well - par for the course with Dakine products. They are lightweight, efficient, and look good too.

If you are new to wing-foiling and unsure of what size to go with for your first wing, I generally recommend getting a 4 meter if you are under 155 lbs, and a 5 meter if you are over 155 pounds and plan to primarily ride in moderate wind speeds (~20-28 mph). If you get two or more wings eventually, try to spread each additional size out by 2 meters from whatever size you start with. Doing this will maximize the wind conditions you can ride in.

I started with a 5m, then added a 3.1m and 6.2m Cyclone to my quiver. I've been really impressed with these wings. Such a neat sport that brings those ocean vibes to any body of water with some wind!
review.name: Stoked on this Dakine Cyclone Wing!

name: Cyclone Wing C2

review.reviewBody: These are my first pair of official mountain biking shoes and they have been great so far. They stick really well to my One Up flat pedals. If you are used to wide toe box shoes, order up a size.
review.name: Nice shoes

review.reviewBody: A shoe that fits well and is stable on the pedals. Much better than tennis shoes or hiking boots
review.name: Nicely stable

review.reviewBody: The size 10 fits like a size 9, so I had to return the size 10 and reordered size 11.  The return process was very easy and customer service was great.  I love the shoe so far although haven't worn them yet and I love the company Competitive Cyclist
review.name: Shoe is 1 size too small

review.reviewBody: I like these a lot. Sizing runs a bit small. I normally wear a 46, which is a 12 in most brands but a 13 here. Nicely made. Definitely will buy again.
review.name: Nice shoe for the wide foot

review.reviewBody:
Decided to go a full size up after reading tons of internet comments. Dont regret it at all. I normally wear 10's in everything and on a whim decided to get 11's. They fit perfectly.

Shoe itself is great.
review.name: Great shoe. Runs small

review.reviewBody: The Livewire packs a lot of value into a $110 shoe. With a stiff construction, tacky sole, and stout toe protection I would buy this shoe over a FiveTen Freerider every time.
review.name: Much better than FiveTen Freerider

review.reviewBody: Great shoes!!! They do run small as others have mentioned I was told before hand to order a 1/2 size larger and they fit perfectly. Wow what a difference from riding with my old hiking shoes they stayed planted to my flat pedals even thru the rough sections. They are super comfortable for long rides and walking in also. The elastic lace holders are a plus no more tucking laces into the sides. With $30.00 off they were a great deal thanks Competitive Cyclist
review.name: Ride Concepts Livewire

review.reviewBody: Seem like great shoes.  I am a true size 42 but had to return because they were tight around the toe.  Maybe half size or full size up.
review.name: Watch sizing.

review.reviewBody: I grabbed a pair of size 13 Livewires during the sale for $80. At that price, it basically undercuts majority of MTB shoes on the market. Though after some time with these shoes, I can safely say I would pay the full 100 for them. The grip is phenomenal and has made climbing steeps and bombing downhill way more stable. My foot never slips off the pedal anymore. They are also comfortable shoes and do not poke in any part of my foot, no hotspots for me. There is definitely a bit of a break-in period where you may feel some tightness on the toes, but that quickly goes away after 2-3 rides. They seem incredibly durable, and I'm not a light easy going rider. They also offer a pretty great amount of protection. I've banged my shoe against a rock and didn't feel a thing. Would definitely recommend the Livewire to anyone looking for a new MTB shoe.
review.name: Best Bang for your Buck

name: Livewire Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this to be part of an emergency kit with the full geopress system. I haven’t used it and probably wont plan to use it until I need it. I have seen plenty of demonstrations of it working though and that’s why I bought the system.

review.reviewBody:
I have 2 GEOpresses I use often. I EDC and and a Ti used in my go bag. 
Isn’t it funny how we drank from the garden house as a kid with zero negative side effects however today it’s taboo. Today we don’t even trust public tap water. I use my Grayl GEOpresses daily with confidence. BTW the Titanium is clearly the best for my needed.

review.reviewBody: Easy to use, reliable. I drank tap water all across asia no problems

review.reviewBody:
I am on the road a lot and use this at various watering holes, restaurants, malls and parks.
Excellent filtering qualities for on-the-go filtration and purification and it makes the water taste great. Love that it removes 99. 9% of waterborne pathogens, bacteria and micro-plastics. The ability to unscrew the large top not just the flip top makes it easy to add your favorite drink mix. Just make sure you purchase the One-Way Electrolyte & Drink Mix Valve. The GeoPress is also very easy to clean as the components are easy to take apart and reassemble. The product has surpassed my expectations and after hundreds of uses and still works flawlessly. Thanks Grayl for making a Superb Water Filtering System.
review.name: 24oz GeoPress® Purifier - Buy it!

review.reviewBody: I bought this shirt for general travel but specifically for a trip to Belize in Sept.  Could not be happier. I was very comfortable on the plane despite the hot airplane in Houston.  While in the jungle it did exactly as advertised. kept the hot sun off me, yes I was hot and sweaty but as soon I stopped in the shade it cooled me down. I washed it in the shower and hung up over night and the shirt was dry the next morning.  Thought I'd add my review simply because I'm on the website looking to get a couple more of these shirts. I'm 5-10 190lbs typically wear size large and this fits perfectly.
review.name: Fantastic travel shirt

review.reviewBody: Bought two, in stone and zinc.  The fit and finish is spot on.  I was strictly a Patagonia guy, but poor availability of the Patagonia tech shirts had me venture out to these.  No regrets.  I get compliments on the fit and color.  My only feedback would be adding buttons to the collar to keep the collar from flapping in your face in high winds.  Aside from that, these shirts are perfect in the Sonoran Desert or for deep-sea fishing off Charleston.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
I used these shirts (gray and blue versions) during a recent trip in Madagascar, photographing lemurs, bushwhacking in the forest with a lot of underbrush, etc. I didn't notice any snags from the prickly underbrush.  I wore a size larger than normal to help keep me more cool, and had to adjust the button on the cuffs, since the cuff were so big.  
The shirt was super comfortable, and kept me cooler than other shirts that I wore. They also dried quickly after washing them in the room, and looked great.  The part that I liked the best (other than the sun protection--never needed sunscreen!) is the pockets.  There are 2 chest pockets with buttons which are easily seen on the photos, but there are also 2 zippered pockets under the button pockets (between the button pockets and your chest) for items that you wish to keep secure.  Also, the drape of the fabric is quite nice, as it has enough body to hang "away" from your arms and torso, which helped to keep me cooler in the hot and humid forests of Madagascar.  It isn't water resistant, which allowed me to treat the shirt with permethrin insect repellent which was key as well.  
Overall, great shirt, and I am thinking of picking up a couple more for everyday use.
review.name: Quick dry, kept me cool, great fabric, nice pockets!

name: Canyon Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The size is perfect for international travel. The frame and handle are pretty sturdy and the wheels roll over rough pavement pretty well. They are about 1/2” larger in diameter than my other trolley type suitcases. I like the fact it can expand when I travel in the U. S. , and pack smaller for travel in the EU.
review.name: The size is perfect for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Too small. Compartment seems too small for the actual size of the case. Will be ordering a sonjourn
review.name: Too small. Compartment seems too

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My wife and I were going to France and I needed a new carry-on bag, so I bought the Osprey Transporter 4-wheel hybrid carry-on bag because I know Osprey makes great products with a great warranty. We just got back from our trip and the bag was fantastic. I had a choice of laying the bag down and loading it from the top or keeping the bag vertical and packing from the bottom on up:) Thank You Osprey for making this bag. Thanks, Darcy
review.name: My wife and I were

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The carry on I have been waiting for. Pretty, functional, comfortable, glides on all floors. I just LOVE it. Thank you Osprey for making the best luggage combining practicality and elegance.
review.name: The carry on I have

review.reviewBody:
Like the concept and bag system. Very dissapointed with loud wheels and indeed their poor quality. 

Apparently no replacemnt wheels available.
review.name: Nice bag with poor wheels.

review.reviewBody: Of course Osprey is known for their easy rolling, dependable wheels, but what I really love about this carry on is the really strong zipper for the 5 liter expansion. On really small airplanes (ex: between islands in French Polynesia) where the +5 size is too large, I just pack everything normally, but then I compress everything to the smaller size by closing 2nd (expansion) zipper. Better than a compression strap!
review.name: Zipper for 5L expansion aids compression

review.reviewBody: Had the 1st Generation of this and had 2 wheels damaged the first trip. Got the 2nd version and after 2 trips, 2 of the wheels get the speed wobbles from being loose already. Pack is great if the wheels work right.
review.name: Gen 2 Wheel Problems

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love this bag. It was exactly what I wanted down to the last detail. Perfect size. Great design. Awesome materials. However, the wheels are terrible. 

After just two trips one of the wheels started wobbling and rattling like a bum wheel on a shopping cart. Now all the wheels, no mater which orientation I roll the bag, rattle, wobble, clatter, and draw attention. The bag now doesn't even track with me as I walk and it's so noisy my wife walks five steps behind me. I watch as people with bags purchased for 1/4 the price roll by me in silence. Meanwhile I'm clanging down the terminal with my wheels bouncing around like crazy. Worst. Wheels. Ever.

BTW, I still love Osprey and have been a loyal fan since my first Osprey pack in 1994.
review.name: Wheels that wobble, clatter, rattle, and shake

review.reviewBody: The bag would be great if it was built to normal Osprey standards, BUT - within a few trips, the wheels bent and became almost unusable (significant wobbling), and after about 18 months of travels, the metal handles snapped in half while rolling through the airport. Otherwise, the bag is solid. Material easily scuffs and gets marked, but has not torn.
review.name: Reliability is a significant issue ...

review.reviewBody: I really like this bad, it's compact, and the gloss black looks really good. I just wish they would put higher quality wheels. They work ok, but why not use full metal wheels with nicely greased bearing? Would provide a really quality feel when rolling through the airport.
review.name: Very good looking in black

name: Transporter 4-Wheel Hybrid 22in Carry On Bag

hasVariant.name: Active Belt 3D Bottle

hasVariant.name: Active Belt 3D Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Active Belt 3D Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love the large bottle size but the belt does not stay put when running. I am curvier and feel like my gluten are pushing the belt up when I run, leading it to jangle around and I have to frequently push it back down.  Pocket also does not fit a phone.
review.name: Good bottle size but

review.reviewBody: I love it so much, and it actually fits my iPhone 13 :-) plus AirPodspro
review.name: so cute!!!

review.reviewBody: Great waist pack for long rides or runs. Doesn’t bounce for me. 6’0” 177lb male athletic build. Fits my iPhone 13pro and a bar or a few gels packs nicely. To load/unload pouch, spin to front as it is difficult to do when at your rear. Just a great simple pack for any longer training. Would still use a vest for a day long adventure, but it serves its purpose.
review.name: Simple and quick. Perfect training size.

review.reviewBody: The unisex fit is not great for my frame (Female, Sized 2-4) the bottle bounces and the the belt rides up my waist and pulls my shirt up - exposing my belly. The zippered pack is useful for keys and ID but is not large enough for my standard sized cell phone, even without the OtterBox.
review.name: Quality is good, but fit isn't perfect
comment: Hi, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: bottle fell out on chair lift while skiing also when out running,had my friends not seen this happen my bottle would be lost,dos not appear to be a way to adjust strap to stop bottle easily falling out.pocket too small for my samsung A54 phone,disappointed with the belt design.
review.name: could and should be a better design

review.reviewBody: Very well made, a bit difficult getting the bottle back in the belt while running.  Generally requires two hands to do quickly.
review.name: Water bottle belt

review.reviewBody: Everything is great about this belt except the small but annoying thing - the pocket does not fit a cell phone... Yes, I always run with my cell phone and this belt requires wearing something else with the pockets... which most of the Salomon running apparel is missing...
review.name: Good running belt but missing important feature
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your ideas with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.reviewBody: It's what I needed, It works fantastically, and It came fairly quick. No complaints.
review.name: Perfect for what I needed  :^)

review.reviewBody: I am not sure if the pocket is intended for holding phones or not, but if you have a phone that is a bit big (S Ultra sizes), the pocket is too small for that. everything else is great.
review.name: great product- pocket a bit small

review.reviewBody: I love this bag, excellent material, very easy to dry, has to compartments, one for the water bottle and another one with zipper, good size for snacks
review.name: I love it, great bag and bottle size!!

name: Active Belt 3D Bottle

review.itemreviewed: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super cute jacket, worn on hikes, as a layer, and in casual situations. I wish it was a little more form-fitting.
review.name: Great color and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: A perfect mid layer for added warmth. I bought mind oversized for quick layer changes in the mountains. The ponytail hole is a small but impactful feature when wearing a helmet or multiple layers!
review.name: Love this jacket

review.itemreviewed: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: It's a little lighter than I anticipated, but great for a chilly run or a spring/autumn day or an extra layer for the air conditioning. It's really comfortable with functional pockets. Sleeves are long with thumb holes, but easy to push up out of the way. I bought two and see a lot of use for them year round.
review.name: Light Weight Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm, quick drying, generous cut. Plenty of room in the shoulders for those of us with an athletic frame. Use it for climbing, hiking, skiing, chilling.
review.name: Great Midlayer

review.itemreviewed: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was going back and forth between this jacket and Patagonias R1. I purchased them both but like the fit of this one much more. The Patagonia R1 fit longer/taller and slimmer, where as this fit me much better- I am 5'6" and 148lbs and pretty average build.
review.name: Comparable to Patagonia's R1

review.itemreviewed: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the colour and the fit.    Even ordered one in a larger size to put a warmer layer underneath.
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great looking mid-layer hooded jacket that's versatile and comfortable . Some of the features are gimmicks that don't prove as useful.
review.name: Great looking and comfotable

review.itemreviewed: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: It has amazing special features, the hood has a little hole you can pull your hair through (long hair types gets really annoying in the alpine), perfect layer, not too hot, not too cold. No complaints.
review.name: Love this jacket!!

name: Aconcagua Light ML Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I bought this hat to tame my locks of fire. I have a lot of hair and it is thick.

It seems as if this hat might be better for those with more of a shallow top of the head (Top-to-ear). I say that because it keep sliding off my head unless I put my hair in a bun and torque down the snapback. 

As far as style and designs go I do like the styles and have no other complaints.
review.name: Stylish for sure

review.reviewBody:
This hat is terribly designed. It sits on the head short and the front of the hat gets all warped and looks awful. Notice the models on the pictures with the warping on the hat face. It looks worse than that in person. 

Returning - but I don't think I should have to pay for return shipping for such an awful product. Disappointing.
review.name: Very poor fit

review.reviewBody: This is a great shoe. My go to for day to day use.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Fantastic shoes! I have a fallen arch & planter fasciitis. Most comfortable shoe I’ve found. Can wear them all day while on my feet with no discomfort. I now own 4 pairs in different colors.
review.name: Thank you Merrill!

review.reviewBody: A very comfortable shoe with good traction on messy trails.
review.name: I very good trail running shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these for the rock plate and all the positive reviews about grip. I've run in 5 other brands and just don't love the outsoles on any. I have about 40 miles in these and they have the worst traction of any trail show I've run in. I love technical trails and thrive on rock hopping routes. I've never slipped so many times on a run than when I wear these. I intended to get 20 miles in my last run, but had to cut it short because I was basically walking everything. I'm sure they are fine for hiking or running on fire roads. If you need to hop rocks, navigate roots, or cross creeks in these things, God help you. At best, they ruin your stride from slipping every 5th step. At worst, they are dangerous on turns, downhills, and wet terrain.
review.name: Like running in roller skates

review.reviewBody: They put the colors no one wants on sail or they only have size 12

Husband and I both have Agility Peak 5’s and love them. We use them for long walks and for hiking. They’re super supportive, comfortable right out of the box, and have been quite durable for the rocky hikes we’ve taken.
review.name: Great Shoes
comment: Thank you for your awesome review.

review.reviewBody: These shoes are great.  Bought a pair 5 months ago for the first time and love the cushion, traction, flexibility, and sole protection.  I never feel rocks.  I run 3-4 times per week in the forest on trails and logging roads, never slip even on the steepest trails. Now I own 2 pairs.  They replace 10+ years of wearing Cascadias.  Every year they changed more and more and finally had to move on and so happy I did.  Wouldn't look back.
review.name: Excellent Trail Running Shoe

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite trail shoes I've found yet. Cushioned enough for distance, comfy on road-to-trail portions, but they still feel plenty grippy and responsive on technical terrain. Some people have complained about having trouble locking down the heel, but I haven't had problems with that. I'd say I have medium/wide feet, and the toebox also has plenty of room for me. (IMO they fit true to size, at least in my case.) Impressed with the durability, as well -- after 300km, still no issues or flaws whatsoever. Fantastic shoe, will definitely be buying another pair.
review.name: My Favorite Trail Shoe

review.reviewBody: I've wore Merrells for work about 4 years now. I have had a couple different models. The initial model that I wore was discontinued; therefore, I had to find a different one. I landed on the Agility Peak 4. And now the AP5. They are extremely comfortable and lightweight! Very important for my job - insurance adjuster (climbing roofs). I appreciate their grip more than one knows!
review.name: Grip keeps me on the Roof!

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite trail runners.  I have walked a lot in the HOKA trail runners, and they are great.  But, the Merrell has a better toe box.  That matters for long downhill hikes.
review.name: Better toe box

name: Agility Peak 5 Shoe - Men's
